NTA. I would #8217;ve called them out the first time it happened. You don #8217;t want #8220;friends #8221; like these, trust me. Find a group of friends who don #8217;t act like middle schoolers. You deserve better and you know it!
ESH. It was kind of you to give her a gift, but you could have thought it through more. She overreacted to a pretty minor inconvenience.

YTA. Distancing yourself instead of talking the issue through with her is childish, especially because you can tell it #8217;s hurting her and she #8217;s overwhelmed. If you #8217;re really best friends you should be able to be honest with her about her kid, how it is impacting you, and maybe, I don #8217;t know, trying to help her figure out how to get a handle on things? You don #8217;t have to fix her or her kid, but you should be there to support her. She doesn #8217;t deserve what you #8217;re doing to her right now.

ESH, but mostly her. From personal experience, it sounds like she either was struggling with some form of an eating disorder previously or is currently. But even if that #8217;s the case, her comments were out of line and incredibly rude. Your retaliation would have been completely acceptable had you not brought up her eating habits.
YTA. How are you even having to ask this?
YTA. Not your issue, and you could potentially fuck up one of your girlfriend #8217;s friendships.

NTA, it is inappropriate even if your husband has good intentions. Would you be opposed to having his ex #8217;s name as your daughter #8217;s middle name? Could be a compromise if you #8217;re comfortable with it.
Oh my god. YTA. What a disgusting thing to do. What you did was so much worse than acting immature on the job. YOU deserve to be fired. For his sake, I hope he never speaks to you again.

I think that focusing the conversation less on her parenting and more on the fact that you are concerned about her and her child #8217;s wellbeing along with the state of your friendship could help. It sounds like she really values your friendship and is going through a rough time. I would acknowledge that you know she #8217;s working her ass off and mothering her child to the best of her ability. Would she ever be comfortable with a babysitter? Maybe you guys could plan a night out and you could offer to pitch in a little for the babysitter #8217;s pay (by no means are you obligated too, though. just an idea!). This is a tough situation, I #8217;m sorry you have to navigate it. I hope all goes well!

NAH. It #8217;s gas money. It #8217;d be different if you were expecting, like, hourly payment. I #8217;d say go ahead and ask but keep in mind that you did kind of offer to help her out without mentioning that you needed gas money right off the bat.
ESH. It sounds like she genuinely has a phobia but isn #8217;t doing anything about it. She #8217;s overreacting to the spider situation and you #8217;re overreacting to her overreaction.
NTA. He crossed a line, and definitely knew better.
YTA. I #8217;ve been on the receiving end of this exact situation and it fucked with my entire day. Don #8217;t be selfish.

NTA. You #8217;re doing her a huge favor and it seems like you #8217;ve been doing it for quite a while. It #8217;d be weird if she wasn #8217;t okay with it. Tbh sometimes you have to sit in a dark room playing a game for a disgusting amount of time.

NTA. Your stepmom was being petty and you retaliated appropriately. You #8217;re not in the wrong.

NTA. And, for the record, babysitting is very much a real job. Many people make a solid career out of nannying because, at the end of the day, childcare is a lot of work. You are absolutely justified to ask for more :)
NTA. You #8217;re not a mind reader, and your friend told you it was okay. She has no right to be mad if you asked her permission and she agreed.

NTA. It #8217;s your wedding, but keep in mind that not inviting him might cause a lot of conflict within the family. Ultimately, whatever choice you make is 100% acceptable. Maybe weighing the pros and cons would help? I know this isn #8217;t an advice forum but my heart goes out to you, and I hope all goes well :) Have a great wedding!
ESH. You #8217;re both young and overreacting. It #8217;d be different if you two were both in your early twenties, but you #8217;re sill teenagers. Plus, $150 isn #8217;t really that much.
NTA. You #8217;re still young and aren #8217;t obligated to buy her anything.

NTA. Like you (and your sister) said, she was in a very fortunate place financially at the time, and you aren #8217;t at that place currently. No need to pay her in general, as it was a gift, but if the opportunity presents itself to help her out in the future without breaking the bank, it might be nice to return (some of) the favor. But no, you #8217;re not the asshole and you #8217;re not a bad sibling. It #8217;s just a shitty situation.

It was a gift and like OP said, when their sister gave them $4k it didn #8217;t impact her financially at all because she was making a good amount of money. Even her sister said it was fine. How is OP the asshole when giving their sister the money would cause them significant financial damage..?

take it SLOW but you #8217;re doing amazing! i was in the hospital for anorexia for a while, and my daily intake was a lot like yours - even a little more; i would let myself have 1200 some days. that being said, they gave me too much food too quickly and i was cramping for a while and freaked out. if this happens DONT PANIC, u can get OTC stuff for the pain/bloating. the bloating goes away and is definitely worth how much better you feel. day by day my dear, and if solid food is too much of an increase u can buy mini protein shakes/supplements to help ur body out. u got this. it #8217;s worth it. ur doing an incredible job. ALSO, one of the fun parts about eating enough food again (aside from the eating part) is that ur randomly going to have the most vivid, colorful dreams. we used to talk about this in treatment a lot, and it was a sign ur brain was healthy and in full gear again. (:

In all honesty, some days I control them and some days they run wild. I'll have obsessive, intrusive thoughts that I said something wrong in a situation and then everyone hates me, that my family thinks I'm weak and doesn't love me, that I've been 'living life wrong' (a bit of Existential OCD), or my favorite: that I don't actually have OCD. What my OCD wants me to do is to 'double-check' #8211; that is, asking my mom if she's sure she loves me, constantly going over with my friends if what I said at a party was weird/awkward, and to obsessively research to see if other people have the same thoughts as me. 'Controlling' it is just doing my best not to act on the desire to check-in with people. It's almost a physical feeling of discomfort when I don't, but the longer I hold off the easier it gets. The best thing for me recently has been having some kind of audio/TV Show/movie in the background so I'm not tempted to loop on those thoughts.

I know a little about OCPD, but I have never known anyone in my life that has it, so if I #8217;m a little off base please feel free to correct me! I think a big difference between us - or any two people with OCD and OCPD - is that a majority of OCD suffers are actually acutely aware of how irrational they #8217;re being. For example, often I fear food. I know this is ridiculous because you need food to survive, but the OCD #8216;voice #8217; is so loud that I #8217;d rather just not eat so I don #8217;t feel terrible about eating. Even when I was hospitalized, I remember crying over eating a sweet potato and I turned to someone mid-breakdown and went #8220;This is so dumb. It #8217;s just a potato! #8221; and then resumed crying. As far as my anxieties go... when I was younger they were much more irrational. Like if I had a passing, violent thought I would assume I was bound to be a serial killer. Now I know that thought was irrational. Presently, my anxieties revolve around #8216;normal #8217; thoughts that most people have ( #8216;do I look fat? #8217; #8216;am I a good person? #8217; #8216;did I say the wrong thing? #8217;) except they #8217;re RELENTLESS and I end up catastrophizing. If you don #8217;t mind me asking, how has having OCPD impacted your life/personal relationships? When did you seek help (or a diagnosis) and how did you know to do so?

I understand completely. I had HarmOCD for quite a while, but mine always ends up shifting every few years. Now I #8217;m just battling an eating disorder because of it. I hope you know now that you are not a terrible person :) Wishing you the best, because it does get better. It might get worse for a bit, but it always gets better.
i really appreciate it :) thank you
this is beautiful. thank you so much. i am sending u so much love. im sorry your time might be shorter than usual, that said i will do my best to live for you. what #8217;s your name?

like many people, i #8217;m prone to anxiety. i actually have ocd, so i #8217;ve been thinking about nothing else for 72 hours (nightmares about it too), glued to the news amp; texting my family in singapore (they went for CNY but are not allowed back inside shanghai - where they live - until feb 2nd i believe). they #8217;re fine, but they #8217;re looking into flying from singapore to australia to see other family. considering there have been cases in both countries, that doesn #8217;t make me feel any better. also, i just finished the stand by stephen king about a week ago. so. feeling great. that being said, WHY do so many people want this to be the end of the world? it #8217;s like they #8217;ll shut down any good news that comes out. is it because it seems interesting from #8216;outside #8217; wuhan? is it movies like contagion or books like the stand that make it seem exciting? i can #8217;t help but feel like so many people in this sub want this to be armageddon. others, i know, are just anxious and wanting to be prepped - i get that. it #8217;s the people scrambling to be the bearers of bad (often fake) news that i don #8217;t understand. anyway, it #8217;s morning and i #8217;m trying to convince myself to leave the apartment. i didn #8217;t know where else to put this. i hope u anxious people are feeling a little better today.
i totally get that! being curious is normal. it #8217;s the people almost rooting for this to be a black plague esque disaster that i don #8217;t understand.

makes a lot of sense :) i suppose i should have made myself more clear: i #8217;m not talking about people who are paranoid and prepped for the worst. i am one of those people. i #8217;m talking about people in this sub (and others) who are deliberately downvoting hopeful news, shutting down promising reports, etc. i DO think everyone should be cautious and take everything with a grain of salt. but there are people who are rooting for the world to end. again, not talking about people like you or anyone else who has responded to this thus far. take care!

WRITING.TITLE: taper question with mental illness
WRITING.TEXT: so i #8217;ve tried to quit before and failed. two weeks ago i didn #8217;t take kratom for 2 days and had a 36 hour panic attack. the only thing that helped was xanax but i do NOT want to get addicted to that. (i went from 15GPD to nothing during this time btw) as soon as i got back on kratom i was fine. i have preexisting mental illness (OCD GAD ) and i think the CT really set it off... but i could be wrong. would tapering help with this issue? i can manage some anxiety but i #8217;m sitting here right now close to tears after not dosing for 12 hours bc my chest is tight and im afraid im going to have a panic attack. im a 21 yr old college student (female, if tht counts for anything). ive been taking for 7 months. pls help, im panicking!

WRITING.TITLE: day one: fast taper
WRITING.TEXT: oh man, i've been doing kratom for about 5 months now. it started out as a nightly thing, then a morning and night thing, and then, more recently, an 'i cannot go 3 hours without kratom or i start to have a panic attack' thing. yesterday i had about 14 grams #8211; that was nearly 24 hours ago. tonight i am taking 8 grams. i know this seems like a weird taper - and it is - but i wanted to do hard jumps to prove to myself i can manage it. that said, i barely managed the WDs today - in class (im a college student, 21f) i started to tense up really badly #8211; my legs were in constant motion, flexing and unflexing, and i was doing the same with my hands because i thought i was going to burst out of my skin. my professor looked extrememly concerned when i pretty much sprinted into the bathroom to splash water on my face. right now my chest is tight, i have bags under my eyes, and i am on the verge of tears because of RLS and anxiety. but i have held out. i forced myself to take public transportation today so that i had to walk and that really helped. anyway, tomorrow i am either dropping a g or .5 g. just wanted to update u all. kratom has ruined my life; i used to be an honor roll student with a scholarship and i have a 2.5gpa now and have fucked up my mental health to another level. but? it'll all work out. it's just going to be hard.
thank you!! and yes it #8217;s so rough... especially when it #8217;s more like restless entire body

WRITING.TITLE: can #8217;t tell if it #8217;s bipolar ii, ocd, or both.
WRITING.TEXT: Hi! BACKGROUND: So I was diagnosed with OCD at 12, have been on over 12 SSRI #8217;s and SNRI #8217;s, and had a six month stint in the hospital for anorexia. I just went to another psychiatrist today who said he thinks I might have bipolar ii. Here #8217;s the thing, though - my hypomanic episodes are definitely on the lesser scale, not flow blown mania. Also, I can sleep during these episodes. Mostly, I just feel like my moods are all over the place, but daily. Like intense swings for no reason, every day. Every night though, I always go back to the anxiety/depression. So I guess I just don #8217;t understand. Has anyone had anything that sounds similar? I #8217;m not asking if this is bipolar - I did read the rules and I don #8217;t expect anyone to diagnose me! - but moreso asking if anyone has a similar experience, maybe with OCD and violent emotional shifts daily as opposed to in longer stretches?

I got you! No worries.

i have this exact same experience. i have to be the best and if i #8217;m not, i #8217;m worthless. any praise i get (you #8217;re so smart!) i feel like i have to prove that i AM STILL smart for the rest of my life. it #8217;s exhausting.

harder for me in the beginning bc my school was NOT a fit for me, which sent me into one of the worst spirals of my life. once i moved to a school i loved, i was okay. learned to manage symptoms a little bit better bc of the forced independence. meeting new people and seeing how they reacted to things helped me too, because i was able to look at my black and white thinking a little bit more and be like well... if [insert friend name here] had that happen to them, i don #8217;t think they would think it was the end of the world.

i never have anger either, only at myself. sometimes i get #8220;angry #8221; at other people and then i #8217;m like wait... maybe that was all my fault... and then i get furious with myself, etc. i #8217;m pretty sure if someone told me i was at fault for a crime i wasn #8217;t alive to commit, i would find a way to blame myself for it and apologize.

i have this (completely anecdotal, unsupported) theory that sometimes ADHD occurs as a comorbid disorder as a coping mechanism of sorts? like i forget things, all the time. and people will be talking to me and i #8217;m distracted by 10000 things at once. when i started taking medicine for ADHD, my BPD symptoms exploded bc i was able to entirely focus on them. sometimes my ADHD is a blessing of sorts bc my attention can be diverted from something that would have otherwise triggered me, if that makes sense? but irdk.

are you on mood stabilizers, by any chance? or have your surroundings changed at all? a lot of the time my mom can predict that i #8217;m going to have a meltdown like a week before i actually do bc of either an intense change in my routine, a bad interaction with a friend, or a more frequent #8216;dead stare #8217; lol. i #8217;m sorry you #8217;re feeling like this.

honestly, what #8217;s helped me the most is realizing that a) my interpretation of what people are feeling about me (which is usually negative) is wrong 80% of the time and b) befriending people who are very, very opposite of me and watching/listening to how they react and feel is beneficial. it pulls me slightly out of the mindset that i can #8216;mind read #8217; everyone and they always feel and react the same as i do. hang in there. there are plenty of people who only like 1:1 interactions. i used to be like that too, and my friends now have a running joke that if they want me to stay late at a party, they have to tell me that the event starts later than it actually does bc after about 3 hours i tap out. there are people who are good for u out there, but u have to be open to finding them, which is hard. but u can do it. ur not alone.

you will be okay! BPD people love hard. i was in a similar situation and cried for a few days after i adopted a kitten, then realized i love her more than anything, and now taking care of her and having a #8216;purpose #8217; has increased my mental health +2 points, at least lol. you can 100% do it. u will take care of it. i promise. u #8217;ll love it and feel like it #8217;s your kid sometimes. u got this.

honestly, because my apartment only allows cats! but I love dogs, and I #8217;ll probably end up getting one at some point. IMO cats and dogs are very different emotionally-dogs will love their owners very very visibly, whereas cats are more covert about it lol. so i think a dog is a great choice with someone with BPD, bc u #8217;ll love them and be able to see the love in return! lt;3 u #8217;ll do great!!!

that sounds so overwhelming! I #8217;m obvs not a professional, but from what I #8217;ve read/experienced it could absolutely be your body reacting to the situation, maybe just a bit before your head does? and a newborn! wow! you #8217;re super tough and resilient, and the fact that you #8217;ve relocated 4 times before is amazing and, I #8217;m sure, exhausting. but you did it before you can do it again. sending love to you!

tw: SA i had an experience with COCSA that i only recalled recently, though it makes a lot of sense considering my triggers. is your therapist one that specializes in trauma? i don #8217;t think she should be diagnosing your mom like that? i #8217;d look into other therapists if i were u. sending u love.
thank you so much for this. my mom told me verbatim that #8220;it really wasn #8217;t bad because you weren #8217;t upset #8221; etc.
u said ur 30 in another post, man. c #8217;mon

dude, honestly, take pills for it. my dad #8217;s entire fam is bald. as SOON as he started to lose his hair, he started taking meds for it (idk what they #8217;re called, i #8217;m a girl w too much hair) and he has the same amount of hair now (49) as he did when he started medicating (33). do it now if u think being bald will bother u. really. no harm it in.

super fair! im speaking from my dad #8217;s experience, and he didn #8217;t have side effects. but could be diff for everyone. he has to take a lot of meds for health issues, so another pill isn #8217;t a lot to him lol. but i assume it could be strange for someone not used to that! good luck :)
yes!
i #8217;d say mine is the episode of drake and josh where they accidentally trap themselves in the treehouse. wasn #8217;t even my fave episode, but i can recall that one scene so clearly.
....a child
i second this. and considering charlotte unfollowed him? i mean, c #8217;mon.

WRITING.TITLE: worth applying?
WRITING.TEXT: hi! so I #8217;ve been looking into teaching via outschool for a while now, but I #8217;ve read a few posts about an updated hiring process. has anyone been hired recently? asking because I want to know if buying a webcam/fixing up my laptop would be worth it. I am a 21 year old female who has been working with kids for about 5 years now, have taught art classes to 2-6 year olds, and play a few instruments (was thinking of maybe doing this as well). any info on the recently updated hiring process would be helpful too! thanks so much!
sanah!
do u remember what interview this is? never read it, only the one where he talks about how his current gf is mean to him n he likes it lmao

the way he delivers #8220;i wish i was people #8221; in the locomotive and #8220;nothing is working with me #8221; in slush puppy gets me every time bc they #8217;re both such simple statements but so heart-wrenching bc they #8217;re not dressed up in his usual metaphors

in all honesty he doesn #8217;t really #8216;sing #8217; so much as lean really hard on some lines and not so much on others which makes the lines hit harder imo. i mean his range is just speaking in the deepest voice of all time - the wails on swan lake
1. OGR 2. Blue Train Lines 3. Slush Puppy 4. The Locomotive 5. Half-Man Half-Shark 6. Stoned Again 7. A Lizard State 8. Emergency Blimp 9. Easy Easy 10. Rock Bottom
this was stupid hard. spent like 15 min on it and i #8217;m already disagreeing with myself bc i didn #8217;t put vidual or the dream on there
im so sorry this was a shit joke post but u answered so i feel bad lmaooo. i #8217;m gonna delete

WRITING.TITLE: TIFU by accidentally taking a double dose of my ADHD meds.
WRITING.TEXT: TIFU by accidentally taking a double dose of my ADHD meds. So I #8217;m prescribed 50mg of Vyvanse, and have been since I was 14. 50mg is a higher dose for someone in my age/weight bracket (early 20s F, 115 lbs) because the highest legal dose is 70mg. Keep this is in mind. I have a bizarre sleep schedule with a cute sprinkle of insomnia, so some nights I don #8217;t fall asleep until 5am, and that #8217;s what happened last night (this morning). I set an alarm for 10am, woke up around 10:30, took my Vyvanse, laid down for a little bit, and somehow fell back to sleep. At about 11:30-12 I wake back up, still groggy. It takes my Vyvanse about 2 hours to fully kick in, so I #8217;m still a little out of it. This is where I fucked up. I #8217;m so used to waking up and just BEING up that I started my morning routine over again on autopilot. I strolled over the coffee machine, started to make some, and took my dose of Vyvanse. I realized about 10 seconds after I #8217;d taken it that I had already taken it. Here #8217;s the thing, I can #8217;t throw up. I #8217;ve thrown up twice in my entire life. So that wasn #8217;t an option. Cue frantic googling. Pretty much everyone says I #8217;m going to be in for a wild day, and to stay hydrated. I try to look on the bright side #8212;maybe I #8217;ll get a lot of work done today! #8212;but I was foolish. It #8217;s been 3 hours since my last dose. I #8217;ve peed around twenty times. I can feel my blood. I took one hit from my Juul and transcended time and space. My stomach is furious. I tried to reorganize my room, started to hammer something into the wall, hit my thumb. Cried. Put my clothes in the dryer and then felt like I needed to have them Extra Dry so I ran them again, the lint in there started burning. Cried. All of my whites now smell like Chicago in 1871. My body is in fight or flight. I #8217;m so anxious. 30 min ago my mom #8217;s best friend texted me #8216;Your parents #8217; and nothing else. By the time she responded to my #8216;??? #8217; fifteen minutes later with the picture of my mom and dad when they were younger that she meant to attach, I had already accepted that I was an orphan and was halfway through an article re: how to deal with the sudden passing of your parents. My cat came into my bedroom and I got scared. I didn #8217;t like her stance or general demeanor. Currently, I #8217;m applying for grad school. I don #8217;t know why. I #8217;m not even done with undergrad. But it feels like something I should do right now. Anyway. I #8217;ll be fine. I #8217;ve actually done this one other time and ended up being alright, just very fast for a while. Have a good one, all. Take meds responsibly. TL;DR I took 100mg of Vyvanse when I #8217;m prescribed 50mg, am currently paranoid, distraught, and feeling like I have an IQ of 1000 and -17 at the same time. EDIT: Holy shit! I appreciate all of the concerns and nice comments lol. I #8217;m doing alright, I #8217;ve had a lot of water and feel 75% normal. Still wide awake, obviously. Hopefully this inspired a few people to use those pill organizers. I just ordered one. Also, I did not finish applying to grad school. I made the amazing decision to take out loans for undergrad in NYC and if I get into any more debt I #8217;ll never be able to afford groceries.

This made me cry. You #8217;re doing fantastic; it #8217;s so hard to make yourself get help when you #8217;re in that kind of state. You #8217;re being an amazing mother BY doing exactly this, which means you DO love your daughter. You #8217;re making an effort to be there for the people you love, and to live your life both for yourself and for them. So so proud of you :)
HAHA this is spot on, I just sent my best friend like 7 messages in a row.
thank you for commenting this, I just considered doing that and decided not to haha
